definition: Li Jun, fictional character from 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
plum
surname Li
(dialectal pronunciation of 俊[jun4])/cool/neat
smart/eminent/handsome/talented

sentences.english: 'We were too young at the time, doing wild things, ' Mr. Li said by email.
sentences.chinese: 李俊通過電子郵件說，我們當時太年輕，淨幹些瘋事。

sentences.english: Only Mr. Li was home when they swooped in on Feb. 3.
sentences.chinese: 警方2月3日突襲這間公寓時只有李俊一個人在家。

sentences.english: Li's donation is designed to in particular benefit a panda named 'Yun.'
sentences.chinese: 李俊捐贈的主要受益者是一隻名爲“雲”的熊貓。

sentences.english: "China is genuinely committed to tackling the impacts of climate change, as manifested by its national strategy, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 李俊峯也認爲中國應該繼續努力應對氣候變化。

sentences.english: Li Jun lives with his grandmother and grandfather, too.
sentences.chinese: 李俊也和他的奶奶爺爺住在一起。

sentences.english: Xinhua described the gift as 'an act of remorse' from Li for associating China's ubiquitous animal with his criminal activity.
sentences.chinese: 新華社稱該捐贈是李俊對自己將犯罪行爲的悔過自新。

sentences.english: Li Junxi let the manufacturer to prosecute Jiang Minhao, said the company infringement.
sentences.chinese: 李俊熙讓這些廠家起訴姜敏浩，說公司侵權。

sentences.english: Li Junmin was a fairly accomplished poet towards the end of the Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 李俊民是金代末年頗有成就的詩人。

sentences.english: In December, Mr. Li was released early for good behavior.
sentences.chinese: 去年12月，李俊因表現良好提前獲釋。

sentences.english: Li didn't respond to an email requesting comment.
sentences.chinese: 李俊未回覆請求置評的電子郵件。

definition: Wang Ying (character in the "Water Margin")
Huang Xin, character in The Water Margin

Song Jiang, a principal hero of the novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传
Wang Ping (1962-2013), PRC crosstalk actor
Li Kui, character in the novel Water Margin 水滸全傳|水浒全传[Shui3 hu3 quan2 zhuan4]
Lin Chong, one of the Heroes of the Marsh in Water Margin
Liangshan city and County in Jining 濟寧|济宁[Ji3 ning2], Shandong
Yang Bin (1963-), Chinese-Dutch businessman
oriole/black-naped oriole (Oriolus chinensis)
Yang Jun (571-600), son of the first Sui emperor 楊堅|杨坚[Yang2 Jian1]
surname Chao
Wu Song, a heroic outlaw of Liangshan po 梁山泊 in the classic novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传, whose exploits including killing a tiger with his bare hands
Liu Yi (-285), famous incorruptible official of Western Jin dynasty the Western Jin dynasty 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316)/Liu Yi (-412), general of Eastern Jin dynasty 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420)
Fang La
Jiangzhou district of Chongzuo city 崇左市[Chong2 zuo3 shi4], Guangxi
